department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.en: The position and velocity of a celestial body are known as its orbital state. Predicting the orbital state of a satellite and how it varies with time is critical both in the case of spacecraft operations, as well as understanding the motion of natural celestial objects such as moons, planets, comets, and asteroids. In this class, we will introduce the fundamental concepts of astrodynamics as applied to the problem of orbit prediction and propagation, as well as its applications to spacecraft and satellite mission design applications. Students will learn how an orbit can be quantified and propagated using Keplerian orbit elements, as well as more advanced techniques accounting for orbit perturbations. The objective is for the student to develop a solid understanding of orbital mechanics and its applications.
goal.ch: 天體的位置及速度統一稱為軌道狀態。衛星軌道狀態的量化、預測與推算對人造衛星作業及瞭解自然天體（如：衛星、行星、彗星、小行星）運動扮演極重要的角色。 本課程將介紹現代軌道運動學基礎概念，以及其對軌道預測、推算、衛星任務設計的應用。選生將學習如何以克卜勒軌道參數量化及推算衛星軌道狀態。另外也將學習如何以數值積分法量化軌道擾動的影響。

content.en:
This class will cover the following main points:
- Coordinate and Time Systems
- Two Body Problem
- Kepler’s Equation, Two Body Propagation, Orbit Determination
- Orbit Maneuvers
- Orbit Perturbations and Effects
- Numerical Propagation
Prerequisites include successful completion of classical mechanics (or equivalent), as well as a course in programming with Matlab or Python (Matlab preferred).“
content.ch:
本課程的重點如下：
- 時間、空間座標
- 二體問題
- 克卜勒方程式、二體軌道推算、定軌
- 軌道變更
- 軌道擾動
- 數值積分推算
必修條件：力學、Matlab或Python程式設計語言（本課將以Matlab為主）。
